TopicTitle: [TechManager] Tech tree: getting science equipment and construction parts faster

Articles.Content:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/5b594rzczwco679/early%20science%20and%20construction%20tree.cfg?dl=0

I have always disliked the arrangement of the tech tree, as I feel it makes starting the game a bit slow. It's probably a great design for new players, but when I play, I feel like I can't really get started until I have half the tech tree unlocked, and by then the contracts are already paying too much and it's basically sandbox at that point. To partially solve this, I made a tweak to the tech tree. This tweak moves most of the data collection tools near the start as well as bringing a handful of construction parts and most of the wing parts much earlier in the tree. This allows you to build your low-tech space station or colony ship in a wide variety of ways and with optimal equipment to get the job done, even though later on you might choose to dock with it to give it some much-needed upgrades.

There are still lots of construction parts to unlock, not so many wing parts but most of the fuselage parts are left later on since you can just use fuel tanks--while ugly it is functional. The bottom of the tech tree is mostly for unlocking electrical parts and is far less important than originally.

Start node now has:

* modular girder segment

* 1x1 structural panel

* thermometer

* barometer

* seismometer

* gravioli detector

Basic Rocketry node now has:

* FL-A5 adapter

* FL-A10 adapter

Stability node now has:

* Swept Wings

* Delta Wing

General Construction node now has:

* M-Beam 200

* Clamp-o-Tron Jr.

And more changes for you to discover yourself! This tech tree configuration file requires the TechManager plugin to run:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98293-0-25-TechManager-Version-1-5

* place folder in GameData

and was built with KSP Tech Tree Editor 0.2.3 (still in alpha):

https://github.com/jcalero/ksp-techtree-edit

https://github.com/jcalero/ksp-techtree-edit/releases/download/v0.2.3/KSP.Tech.Tree.Editor.v0.2.3.Alpha.zip

* place folder anywhere, save your files in GameData

You only need TechManager to run this tech tree: just put both TechManager and this file (link at top of post) into KSP's GameData folder. If you do try using KSP Tech Tree Editor, note that it sometimes will remove tech from certain nodes when you open a new file. You can get the tech put back where it belongs using this reference: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Technology_tree and the ctrl+f tool (for windows).

So tell me what you think guys, and if you have any similar ideas for a tech tree, share yours below! I'm open to suggestions in improving my tree!
